pros: Great students and strong support staff

pros: Lots of experience to be gained in lots of related fields to your position. Culture is laid back most of the time. Encouragement is placed on using the free advanced degree (MBA) program for staff. Flexibility on schedule, good vacation time (if you can use it) good benefits.
cons: Lack of advancement opportunities. Culture is very suspicious and closed door. Compensation is sub par. Understaffed is pretty much true for every department. Those who try to drive change are frequently silenced or burn out before advancement is made.

review_title: A great opportunity to grow and meet some good people, but limited in terms of upward mobility.
pros:
- great people
- good benefits
- opportunity to get a lot of varied experiences
- transferable skills that you can take into professions outside of higher education
cons:
- depending on your position, there is a limited amount of opportunity to advance
- more of a general higher education concern, but there is lower compensation

pros:
Friendly Environment
Sense of family in majority of university
Great benefits, vacation time is generous
Tuition reimbursement am plus
Working with students a plus
cons:
Disconnect with upper management and the university as a whole
No transparency in upper management
Strategic plan is not conveyed 
Direction of the university is not clear

job_title: Customer Service Analyst in Columbus, OH
pros: I learned a lot and made lifelong connections. Many students have been hired on later and they offer great recommendations when you move on to the next step in life.
cons: As a student job there is only so far up in pay you can go. There is a lot of work done and responsibilities gained, however, the pay is set on a university level.

pros: The professors and students there are very helpful, and they always strive to make the working environment better for everyone
cons: Nothing that comes to mind, maybe if they increase the pay a little taht would be nice

pros: Great people doing a tough job, in a challenging business climate

pros: I've been there 17 years, and will not leave. A great opportunity to work with students.
